meanings.sent1: She overcorrected her mistake by fixing it too many times.
meanings.sent2: He always drives overcorrected, making sure to follow all the rules.
meanings.sent3: The robot overcorrected its path and ended up spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's strictness in grading sometimes leads to an overcorrected final score.
meanings.sent5: The chef overcorrected the seasoning, making the dish too salty to eat.

meanings.definition: To make corrections that are excessive or unnecessary.
meanings.sent1: They overcorrected the document, changing every detail multiple times.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcorrected her artwork, erasing and redoing parts repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The computer program overcorrected the spelling, turning 'color' into 'colour'.
meanings.sent4: His constant need to overcorrected everything often leads to delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the player not to overcorrected his swing, as it could affect his performance negatively.
